title: Mountain Trekking in the Atlas Mountains
description: Join us for a challenging mountain trek through the stunning Atlas Mountains in Morocco and summit the highest peak in North Africa. This trek is perfect for those who want to experience the beauty of the Atlas Mountains and the rich culture of Morocco. We will spend 4 days trekking through the mountains, passing through small villages and enjoying the breathtaking views. The trek is led by an experienced mountain guide who will ensure your safety and comfort throughout the trip. This trek is suitable for those with a good level of fitness and some hiking experience.

activities.name: Skiing
activities.description: Skiing can be a means of transport, a recreational activity or a competitive winter sport in which the participant uses skis to glide on snow. Many types of competitive skiing events are recognized by the International Olympic Committee (IOC), and the International Ski Federation (FIS).

activities.name: Hiking
activities.description: Hiking is a long, vigorous walk, usually on trails or footpaths in the countryside. Walking for pleasure developed in Europe during the eighteenth century. Religious pilgrimages have existed much longer but they involve walking long distances for a spiritual purpose associated with specific religions.

activities.name: Trekking
activities.description: Trekking is a form of walking, undertaken with the specific purpose of exploring and enjoying the scenery. It usually takes place on trails in areas of relatively unspoiled wilderness.

activities.name: Climbing
activities.description: Climbing is the activity of using one's hands, feet, or any other part of the body to ascend a steep object. It is done recreationally, competitively, in trades that rely on it, and in emergency rescue and military operations. It is done indoors and out, on natural and manmade structures.

activities.name: Mountaineering
activities.description: Mountaineering is the set of activities that involves ascending mountains. Mountaineering-related activities include traditional outdoor climbing, skiing, and traversing via ferratas. Indoor climbing, sport climbing and bouldering are also considered mountaineering by some.

notices.name: Altitude sickness is a risk at high elevations.
The trek can be physically demanding.

take_into_account.name: Bring warm clothing as temperatures can drop significantly at high elevations.
Bring sunscreen and a hat to protect from the sun.

guide.name: Rime Machiche
guide.title: Mountain Guide
guide.bio: I am an experienced mountain guide with over 10 years of experience leading treks in the Atlas Mountains. I am passionate about sharing my love of the mountains with others and helping them discover the beauty of Morocco. I speak English, French, and Arabic fluently and have extensive knowledge of the local culture and history. I look forward to welcoming you to Morocco and showing you the best of the Atlas Mountains!

reviews.comment: Rime was a great mountain guide. He was very patient and helped me learn how to climb in no time. I would definitely recommend him to anyone looking for a mountain guide in Morocco!
Rime was a great mountain guide. He was very patient and helped me learn how to climb in no time. I would definitely recommend him to anyone looking for a mountain guide in Morocco!
Rime was a great mountain guide. He was very patient and helped me learn how to climb in no time. I would definitely recommend him to anyone looking for a mountain guide in Morocco!

destination.label: Mount Toubkal
destination.description: Mount Toubkal is the highest peak in the Atlas Mountains and North Africa. It is located in Toubkal National Park, about 60 km south of Marrakesh. The mountain is a popular destination for trekkers and climbers due to its accessibility and stunning views. The summit offers panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys. The mountain is also home to a variety of wildlife, including Barbary sheep, wild boar, and the endangered Barbary macaque.

local_customs: Respect local traditions and dress modestly. Haggling is a common practice in markets.

steps.label: Marrakesh to Imlil
steps.description: On the first day, we will drive from Marrakesh to Imlil, a small village at the base of Mount Toubkal. We will spend the night in a traditional Moroccan guesthouse in Imlil.

steps.label: Imlil to Toubkal Base Camp
steps.description: On the second day, we will begin our hike to Toubkal Base Camp. The hike takes about 6 hours and passes through small villages and beautiful landscapes. We will spend the night in a tent at the base camp.

steps.label: Toubkal Base Camp to Summit
steps.description: On the third day, we will wake up early to begin our ascent to the summit of Mount Toubkal. The hike to the summit takes about 4-5 hours. We will enjoy the breathtaking views from the summit before descending back to Toubkal Base Camp

steps.label: Back to Imlil
steps.description: On the third day, we will descend back to Imlil. The descent takes about 4 hours. We will spend the night in a traditional Moroccan guesthouse in Imlil.

steps.label: Day 4: Imlil to Marrakesh
steps.description: On the fourth and final day, we will drive back to Marrakesh. The drive takes about 2 hours. The trip ends upon arrival in Marrakesh.

meetingPoint.instructions: We will meet at the main entrance...

Great experience overall. The food could have been better, but the trek itself was amazing!
